title: Low Priority Queue
body:
LeaverBuster is a good way in punishing those who leave games mid way but for it to affect those who couldn't connect before a game starts is unreasonable... if you are unable to connect to a game those in it will already be able to remake + Not lose any LP but those who couldn't connect are 1. Punished in losing LP and 2. A low priority queue???? How is a summoner not being able to connect to the beginning of the game impacting the game at all if the option for a remake is possible? 

I don't see why this a thing to people who may have a connection issue once.. to be punished in such way.

replies.body:
If you couldn't connect to the game from the start and your team has to /remake the game, then you wasted the time of everyone else in that game, both allies and opponents. This is why you are punished for being the "leaver" in a /remake.

Plus, if there was no punishment, then people could "leave" the game during the loading screen (before it starts) and have their team /remake it to avoid any unwanted situations. This would essentially just be another form of queue dodging, but you waste more time of everyone else and you don't get a punishment.

I understand that, and i understand the need for punishment but its basically overkill on how it is given out. 5 low priority queue's, and you lose lp? That's a ridiculous amount of punishment for something so minuscule...

The 5-game penalty only shows up if you have a *consistent* and *recent* trend of disconnections. You'll **never** get this type of penalty for disconnecting from a *single match*. 

Feel free to leave feedback on the system in a post on the [Miscellaneous Boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous) if you'd like.
